title: Citibank Malaysia Launches HwangDBS China Select Fund
summary: Kuala Lumpur – Citigroup First Investment Management Ltd. ("CFIM") in cooperation with HwangDBS Investment Management Bhd. ("HwangDBS IM") today launched the HwangDBS China Select Fund ("the Fund") the first-of-its-kind feeder fund that allows Malaysian investors to benefit from the expertise of China's leading asset management company and the growth opportunities of China companies listed locally and globally.
tag-1: Citibank Malaysia Launches HwangDBS China Select Fund
tag-3: Kuala Lumpur – Citigroup First Investment Management Ltd. ("CFIM") in cooperation with HwangDBS Investment Management Bhd. ("HwangDBS IM") today launched the HwangDBS China Select Fund ("the Fund") the first-of-its-kind feeder fund that allows Malaysian investors to benefit from the expertise of China's leading asset management company and the growth opportunities of China companies listed locally and globally.
tag-4: The Fund feeds into the China Select Fund (the "Target Fund"), which is the first Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission-authorized Chinese equity fund to be sub-managed by ChinaAMC (Hong Kong), the Hong Kong branch of China's largest fund management company, China Asset Management Co. Ltd. ("ChinaAMC").
tag-5: Jeremy Collard, Managing Director & Regional Head of CFIM Asia Pacific, said: "What makes the Fund unique is that it provides investors access to the expertise of China's leading asset management company, which was not previously available in Malaysia. We believe that by combining CFIM's international platform and strong corporate governance with ChinaAMC's domestic expertise and insight in stock selection, we are providing investors with a significant opportunity to benefit from China's unrivalled growth potential. ChinaAMC is China's largest and top-ranking fund management company with $34.23 billion in assets under management ("AUM")1 and is ranked number one by AUM in every major fund category in China.2"
tag-6: Teng Chee Wai, Chief Executive Officer and Executive Director of HwangDBS IM, added: "Our partnership with CFIM and China Asset Management Co. Ltd. offers Citibank Bhd's high net worth investors another avenue to diversify their investment portfolio and generate growth from one of the world's most exciting growth story: China. Given the current low growth and low interest rate environments in the Developed Markets and sovereign debt crisis in Europe, growth will naturally come from Asia, especially the Emerging Markets. In this instance, China presents the most compelling growth potential. With its healthy fundamentals and the benefit of China's largest fund manager's local insights, this Fund presents investors a winning tilt to reap the upside potential of the China growth story."
tag-7: The Target Fund's investment strategy is a combination of bottom-up stock selection and top-down macro and sector overlay, and the selection is not limited to locally listed stocks but also includes those listed on leading exchanges globally. Approximately 10 to 30 percent of the Target Fund's portfolio will have indirect exposure to China A-shares listed on the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, and the remaining 70 to 90 percent of the Target Fund's assets will be invested in China companies listed globally in Hong Kong, the U.S., Taiwan and Singapore.
tag-8: Anthony Ho, Deputy Chief Executive Officer of China Asset Management (Hong Kong) Ltd., said: "China offers enormous growth opportunities. China is already the second largest global economy. Domestic consumption is expected to play a more important role, urbanization continues to boost capital expenditure, and new industries are emerging. Given their market potential and positive long-term growth outlook, Chinese equities are currently under-represented in the global equities portfolio. The Target Fund has been designed to enable investors gain exposure to these market opportunities."
tag-9: In closing, Teng said, "The HwangDBS China Select Fund offers investors all the important ingredients to capitalize on China's potential: investment skills and local expertise."
tag-10: Fund Facts: The open-ended Fund is suitable for qualified investors who are risk tolerant, seek capital appreciation and have a long-term investment horizon. The HwangDBS China Select Fund is exclusively distributed by Citibank Berhad during the initial offer period from 11 July 2011 to 31 July 2011.
tag-11: The Fund is locally managed by HwangDBS IM and it feeds into the China Select Fund (the "Target Fund") that is managed by CFIM and sub-managed by China Asset Management (Hong Kong) Ltd. The minimum initial investment is RM30,000.
tag-12: 1Source: Wind Info, as at 31 March 2011. Data includes mutual funds offered to the public only.  2Source: Wind Info, as at 31 March 2011. Data includes mutual funds offered to the public only.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-14: Citigroup First Investment Management Ltd. CFIM, the manager of the China Select Fund, is a global asset management business established within Citigroup Global Markets. CFIM is incorporated in Hong Kong and is regulated by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission (SFC). CFIM manufactures investment funds that leverage Citi's institutional expertise in research, trading, structuring and risk management. CFIM funds are tailored to institutional, retail and wealth management clients. Since launching its first investment fund in August 2007, CFIM has launched 27 closed and open-ended funds as of July 2011, with aggregate AUM over US$5 billion.
tag-15: HwangDBS Investment Management Berhad  2011 marks HwangDBS Investment Management Berhad's ("HwangDBS IM") 10th Anniversary. Today, HwangDBS IM manages corporate, institutional and retail funds and has to date, launched an impressive portfolio of both local and global funds. The Company is supported by Hwang-DBS (Malaysia) Berhad which, through its primary subsidiary, has over 37 years of experience in the securities industry and award winning DBSAM, which has more than 28 years of investment management experience.
tag-16: HwangDBS IM distributes its funds through its direct sales team, the local and international banks and its own internal agents. Their head office is located in Kuala Lumpur and is represented throughout the peninsular and east Malaysia. Shareholders of HwangDBS IM are Hwang-DBS (Malaysia) Berhad (53%), DBS Asset Management Ltd. (DBSAM) (30%) and Y.A.M. Tunku Dato' Seri Nadzaruddin Ibni Almarhum Tuanku Ja'afar (17%).
tag-17: For more information please visit www.hdbsim.com.my
tag-18: ChinaAMC (HK) ChinaAMC (HK) was established in September 2008 as a fully-owned subsidiary of ChinaAMC. ChinaAMC (HK) is licensed by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) to engage in asset management and securities advisory activities and represents part of China AMC's strategy to expand its business overseas. Since August 2009, ChinaAMC (HK) has launched offshore funds that invest in both domestic and overseas Chinese companies.
tag-19: ChinaAMC is China's largest and top-ranking fund management company in terms of AUM with US$34.23 billion as at 31 March 20111. With over 12 years experience in China, ChinaAMC has one of the longest operating history amongst its peers and is ranked number one by AUM in every major fund category in China2.
tag-20: ChinaAMC is currently one of the fund managers for the People's Republic of China's national Social Security Fund as well as the corporate pensions and separate accounts for leading Chinese institutions and corporations such as the Bank of China, ICBC, China Construction Bank, China Petrochemical Company and State Grid.
